channel.title: iStealer
channel.description:
Well, apparently someone attached it to a client I guess I used. I was wondering how it worked, and if it created a file that is constantly stealing your info.
From what I heard, you attach it to a file where it remains undetectable, and steals all of your info (Saved passwords, history, etc...) when used, but doesn't do anything while it's currently not open.
So that brings me to the question: Since I have now changed all of my passwords, do I still have anything to worry about?
Thanks,
~Lin

item.title: iStealer
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

His only goal was to find RWT methods. It was pretty funny.

Read full topic

item.title: iStealer
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:4, topic:288095”]Was the client downloaded from this site?[/quote]Most likely. I only download ones when I play a server, and only play servers from here because it’s the only one with a good status page.

I shouldn’t have anything to worry about, as Fellixombc, The Soul, and Hidendra all talked to him while he was on my MSN, and I read the conversations, and he said he wasn’t gonna hack (as in change passwords, etc) me. He also kept calling me a her and managed to get my sister’s MySpace xD

Read full topic

item.title: iStealer
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

Chassy13:

Was the client downloaded from this site?

No over msn, I talked to the guy for 1-3 hours.

xx qwertyuiop xx:

From a google search I’ve gathered that it steals passwords from programs such as browsers (ie & ff), steam, msn, etc. and uploads them to an ftp server. If the program is still present on your computer it could possibly steal your passwords again. If you think you’ve removed it from your computer, you should be safe.

Yes, it binds with the program given, in Lin’s case, RSClient. Once he ran it, it uploaded all his passwords to this guys ftp. Its sort of a keylogger. Virus scanners don’t pick it up. Thats what he told me, over msn, but ask Lin. He told me it was a file called “RSClient.exe”

Read full topic

item.title: iStealer
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Yeah, I guess you’re right. The only way he could know is if none of his accounts are ever accessed by someone else.

Read full topic

item.title: iStealer
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:5, topic:288095”]If you think you’ve removed it from your computer, you should be safe.[/quote]Not really, if you think you’ve removed it but you haven’t and don’t know it, how would you be safe?

Read full topic
